title: Health-AQ Surveillance Integration: Cross-Sectoral Systems Map
description: Link PM2.5 data to hospital admissions for evidence-based intervention

nodes.label: Air Quality
nodes.description: Health-AQ Surveillance: PM2.5 linked to hospital admissions data

links.quantification: Evidence linkage → 10 µg/m³ PM2.5 = 8% respiratory hospitalizations → mortality burden quantified at ₹50K Cr/year → policy urgency justified
Hospital data integration → 102 cities map health hotspots → AQ action prioritized in high-burden wards → ₹2K Cr health-targeted investments
NO2-asthma correlation exposed → traffic restrictions near schools → 25% childhood asthma reduction in intervention zones → ₹300 Cr health savings
Coal plant health costs quantified → ₹8K Cr/year in SO2-related diseases → economic case for early retirement → 5 GW plant closures accelerated
Data linkage barriers: Health privacy laws prevent PM2.5-hospital record integration → anonymization protocols needed → 3-year regulatory approval
Health validation → community trusts AQ data → behavioral change (mask use, indoor purifiers) → exposure reduction → health improves (reinforcing)
Requires sentinel hospital network: Surveillance only works with 500 hospitals reporting standardized data → ICMR integration prerequisite
Via intervention: Traffic curbs → NO2 declines → asthma ER visits -18% → school attendance improves → educational outcomes cascade
Via liability: Health cost data → plant operators face ₹5K Cr litigation → insurance premiums rise → financial incentive for compliance
Via fence-line exposure: Worker health records show occupational risk → community proximity concerns validated → industrial buffer zone enforcement
